definition: can be enjoyed by scholars and lay-people alike (idiom)
common/general/to share/together/total/altogether/abbr. for 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3], Communist party
to bestow (a reward)/to give (to an inferior)/to hand down/a reward (bestowed by a superior)/to appreciate (beauty)

sentences.english: Good literature and art works should suit both refined and popular tastes.
sentences.chinese: 優秀的文藝應該是雅俗共賞的。

sentences.english: Study on the origin of tea culture;
sentences.chinese: 茶文化雅俗共賞，具有廣泛的社會性。

sentences.english: Shakespeare was a great master of the English language at all its levels.
sentences.chinese: 莎士比亞是運用雅俗共賞的英語的大師。

sentences.english: But one supreme pleasure that spans all people is laughter.
sentences.chinese: 但是有一樣極致的樂趣雅俗共賞，那就是歡笑。

sentences.english: Let's find sth. that highbrows and lowbrows alike can enjoy.
sentences.chinese: 怎樣才能雅俗共賞纔好。

sentences.english: And he and actor Zhao Benshan perform during the concert.
sentences.chinese: 期間，演員趙本山也助陣朗朗的演奏會，雅俗共賞。

sentences.english: The tea culture, which is a very refined and popular culture carries widely a social nature.
sentences.chinese: 茶文化雅俗共賞，具有廣泛的社會性。

definition: cultured and refined (idiom); gentle and cultivated
to have a unique style of one's own (idiom)
after hard work and numerous revisions (idiom)/the vicissitudes of life
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
to master the subject via a comprehensive study of surrounding areas
different routes to the same destination (idiom); fig. different means of achieve the same end
to blend into one another/to blend together well
